TopicTitle: [0.23.5] StretchySRB: A StretchyTanks Continuation v9 Final Pre-PP edition 3/21/14

Articles.Content:
blackheart612: looks awesome!

Segmenting is fakeable: that's what my original SRB texture fakes, along with the autoWidthDivide stuff: when you stretch it vertically it adds more segments on the texture.

If you want *actual* segments, then right now your option is the Advanced SRB mod. What might short-term work better is allowing different nozzle/skirts for the SRB.

(As, reading the next page, suggested by DasBananenbrot)

And yes, nozzle resizing based on thrust (and a limit to thrust, based on maximum possible nozzle size for that diameter tank) is coming, per discussion I had with Ferram, oh, must be near a month ago. I just kinda forgot (and got busy doing other stu--OOH, SHINY).

blackheart612, don't you go underestimating! Your stuff is *darn* awesome.

Thank you

I forgot to add, if anybody likes white nozzles for the SRBs, you can get it here

Caution though, it would change the SRB Nozzles forever unless you have a backup. You know it already

Edit for Nathan:

The "fakeable" segmenting goes on and on but the texture can be cut. Config can easily be changed but I wanted it to be a whole texture so that a corner ends to a corner. (Because I tried that config for the texture already)

Thank you for your efforts Nathan! Didn't say yet but this mod is amazing

Edit2:

Is model changing (like cones) and adding it to SRB (skirted/nonskirted) and stretchy tanks (like STS EFT models with a long pipe-like stuff on the side) feasible?

Edited February 6, 2014 by blackheart612
Does anybody even read this?

And yes, nozzle resizing based on thrust (and a limit to thrust, based on maximum possible nozzle size for that diameter tank) is coming, per discussion I had with Ferram, oh, must be near a month ago. I just kinda forgot (and got busy doing other stu--OOH, SHINY).

Resizing nozzles is shiny! Go chase the shiny resizing nozzles Nathan!

More seriously, it'd be nice to have that, since otherwise I'll have to build a mortar rocket to take advantage of it for fun and profit (it does minimize gravity losses, so there's a reason too).

I hope "shiny resizing nozzles" mean texture changer support for the nozzle also.

like sides {} ends {} and then nozzles {} woooh

blackheart612: looks awesome!

Segmenting is fakeable: that's what my original SRB texture fakes, along with the autoWidthDivide stuff: when you stretch it vertically it adds more segments on the texture.

If you want *actual* segments, then right now your option is the Advanced SRB mod. What might short-term work better is allowing different nozzle/skirts for the SRB.

(As, reading the next page, suggested by DasBananenbrot)

And yes, nozzle resizing based on thrust (and a limit to thrust, based on maximum possible nozzle size for that diameter tank) is coming, per discussion I had with Ferram, oh, must be near a month ago. I just kinda forgot (and got busy doing other stu--OOH, SHINY).

blackheart612, don't you go underestimating! Your stuff is *darn* awesome.

I can't wait for it Well guess a week or two it takes at least (you said you are away this and next week right?) but the promise that it will come is far more than enough right now . You're awesome

Thank you

I forgot to add, if anybody likes white nozzles for the SRBs, you can get it here

Caution though, it would change the SRB Nozzles forever unless you have a backup. You know it already

Thanks and I was just about to ask Thanks again for those awesome shuttle based textures

Now can someone make a patch for Kerbal Isp Difficulty Scaler and this to work right together, the srbs are useless for me because i'm using Kerbal Isp Difficulty Scaler instead of the normal configs for RSS. By the way,1.4 works right for that if you want the Kerbal X to just make orbit.

Edit! Random idea! Have a way for the conical tanks to have they're sides bow out (or in, but that might look a bit silly).

I meant more for having just rounded cones like the top of the shuttle's tank and such, having this would make Soyuz based rockets easier though.

Also, if this gets added, also add a thin so the farthest out point of the curve and be moved forwards or backwards of the middle of the tank, with the curve to the farther end of the tank being flatter and the curve to the closer one being steeper.

@blackheart Just a short question... Did you add the Shuttle skins to your first pack and then updated the download or did you made a seperate pack for the shuttle skins? Because I hadn't the time to install your first texture pack until now and want to know if I know just have to install the package from the second download or if I have to install them both ( the donwloads have slightly different names so that is why I am confused )
@bs1110101 that feature is already there, if I understood what you were talking about. Press the 'b' key while over a conical tank, it will take different shapes

Question: Is there any way to go back when pressing the texture button? I can't seem to figure it out... and my forum search isn't returning anything useful.

man. this mod makes it very easy to declutter my part count along with Modular Fuels. wow. really makes it so easy to delete/hide the non stretchy fuel tanks.

Question: Is there any way to go back when pressing the texture button? I can't seem to figure it out... and my forum search isn't returning anything useful.

You mean going back to the previous texture? texture cycling only work via the T button so you just have to cyle through until you are back at your favored texture ..

You mean going back to the previous texture? texture cycling only work via the T button so you just have to cyle through until you are back at your favored texture ..

derp... I figured it out anyways haha. Turns out you have to press T a few times after you get to the last texture. I just thought it didn't cycle back to the first one
